1.content:
Welcome to the City of Metropolis, population: 10 Million. It's a large city, featuring a booming economy, with some of the largest tech companies in the world in both Blackridge Inc. and Pauntech. The city is surrounded by rural farmland and a giant swamp to the South, Citiville to the West, a large Ocean to the East, and an expansive evergreen forest to the north. Despite being one of the fastest growing and most proserpous cities on planet earth, it's also one of the most unsafe, due to a large population of Super Villains constantly attempting to do the city and its residents harm. The good news is, with Super Villains come Super Heroes, and Metropolis has two of the best in Birdboy and Catgirl.


But you knew all that already. What you're here to do is to peak into the lives of the citizens of Metropolis, and to see how they go about their day, and, more importantly, how they deal with all of the Villains running around.


Enough with the formal intro, though! Let's get started!
1.title: Welcome to Metropolis!

11.content:
Kelly Anderson is a bank teller at Metropolis Central Bank & Trust, the largest bank in all of Metropolis. With it being the largest bank, it tends to get robbed, a lot. Some days, just by some masked thugs, but on other days, unfortunately, a villain and their crew will show up and decided to help themselves to the drawers and the safes, in order to fund their evil schemes.


On this particular day, Kelly was running twenty minutes late to work, due to traffic, which in turn was due to the road work that was being done, in order to fix the massive crater that lay in the middle of fifth street, after Catgirl and Braun Beatdown were doing battle last night. Kelly ran to her window and opened it, hoping her boss hadn't noticed her late punch in just yet. Kelly sat down and started to straighten her drawer up, when suddenly, Kelly's arm knocked over her coffee, spilling it all over her blouse. Kelly sighed, frustrated with how the day was going so far. Kelly ran off to the restroom to attempt to clean herself up.


Kelly wasn't in the restroom for a full minute before the sound of a shotgun going off, and a voice yelling "Everyone on the ground, this is a stick up!" could be heard from the lobby. Kelly thought quickly and decided to hide in one of the bathroom stalls, sitting on the toilet and tucking her knees to her chest, in order to hide the fact that she was sitting in the stall.

Kelly tried to keep quiet and pull out her phone to call the police. But just who where the perpetrators of the crime?
11.title: Kelly, the Bank Teller

choices: Kelly tries to get to her phone, which she left at her desk, to call for help
111.content:
Kelly sat in the stall, shaking as she wrapped her arms around her legs, trying to tell herself that everything would be okay. Kelly made note to herself that it was probably time to move away from Metropolis, and get away from all of these horrible villains that plagued the city. She silently tried to calculate her own savings, to see if she had enough to pay for moving expenses and and a new apartment somewhere else. Kelly's thoughts were interrupted as the door to the bathroom burst open, and several pairs of feet marched into the room, along with a woman screaming and crying. Kelly recognized the woman making the commotion as her coworker, Samantha. Samantha's teller window was right next to Kelly's, and the two frequently talked during work- not enough to call each other friends, but enough that Kelly had grown fond of Samantha.


"Please, don't do this!" Samantha screamed, as she was drug further into the bathroom. Kelly clasped a hand over her mouth and nose, trying to suppress her own breathing. Whoever had been dragging Samantha spoke, and Kelly was surprised to not recognize the voice. She thought she'd gotten to know most of the Villains in Metropolis pretty well from the frequent hiests, but this one was brand new to her. The voice tucked away just a bit of a Louisiana southern drawl, while somehow being haunting enough to send a chill down Kelly's spine.

"I warned you, Samantha. If you didn't open the vault, I was going to shit in your mouth."

Kelly held her breath and closed her eyes tightly shut, knowing that her coworker was about to experience the hell these Villains could cause first hand. Outside of the stall, Abigail and two of her servant girls held Samantha captive. The two servants held Samantha's arms as Abigail hiked up her dress, revealing her gigantic, pale, sweaty ass. Samantha screamed in horror once more, before Abigail plopped down on her face and unleashed a torrent of diarrhea down onto Samantha, not only getting it into her mouth, but blanketing Samantha's face in hot, liquid shit. Eventually Abigail got off and fixed her dress, before ordering the girls up as well. They left Samantha lying in a puddle of Abigail's shit.

"Find another teller." Abigail barked at her girls. "One of them will open the vault. Especially after they see what we've done to their coworkers..." Abigail and her girls marched out of the bathroom.


Kelly was confused. Why did this woman seem so hell bent on getting into the vault? Doing that would take time, wasn't she afraid Birdboy and Catgirl would show up?

Kelly had to do something...
111.title: Hillbilly-looking backwoods cult members?

112.content:
Kelly swore under her breath as she desperately attempted to contact the police, but something seemed to be jamming her phone signal. In the few years she had been working for the bank, she picked up a few ques as to what type of robbery she was dealing with. Whenever their phones were rendered useless, it was usually the result of some high tech device made to stifle communications with police.

A shudder went through her body as she realized that she was dealing with a super villain of some sort. With no one to call, all she could do was huddle on top of the toilet and pray that Birdboy or Catgirl would come to save them all in time. She took in deep breaths as she heard the chaos unfolding outside the restroom. She could vaguely make out the sounds of someone's voice barking orders to the tellers, though she couldn't quite make out who it was from where she was.

Soon enough, everything went quiet. For a moment Kelly thought that she was in the clear, though she wasn't willing to go out and check. She had no idea whether or not they were still out there, plus she still didn't know which villain was pulling the heist. If she were lucky, it would be someone like The Cougar, who only focused her attention on young men. On the other hand, she could poke her head out the door and find herself bound and gagged at the feet of Footgirl. No amount of submission or compliance would ensure her safety in that situation.

As she weighed her options, a sudden noise caused her to freeze in place. She slowly pressed her ear to the door and held back a gasp as she could hear the sounds of footsteps approaching the restroom. She prayed that whomever it was would just pass her by, and her heart sank as soon as she heard the door creak open. She held her breath, both to keep from making any noises and because of the pungent odor that seemed to follow whomever it was that had just entered.

A lump formed in Kelly's throat as she could see a shadow just underneath her door.

'Please don't find me... please, please don't find me...', she silently plead as nervous tears streamed down her cheeks.

Alas, it was not to be. The door shot open and to her horror, she found herself staring at the barrel of a shotgun. The man before her was decked out in elaborate, face concealing armor. On the chest was an insignia, indicating that he was under the employ of...
112.title: A fully armed militia?

12.content:
What’s worse than a being a guard at Maximum security? Being a prisoner.

Wendy Williams

A short red headed 25 year old woman. She stands at 5’2 with her short hair coming down just past her ears. Wendy was used to wearing lab coats but must now get more used to the ugly prison orange outfits.

A research assistant for Metropolis once working with the most brilliant minds of the city. She came up with an ingenious solution to Sluggette’s slime, a simple spray that could dissolve the foul smelling mixture. What should have been a great triumph for her ended up causing her endless misery. Sluggette sued her for infringing on her personal fluids, what should have been a laughably easy court turned against her when her own lawyer sided with Sluggette. The jury all seemed to just accept anything they said.

The Mayor a Miss Jessica Woods wanted to be tough on her and sentenced her to prison. Not just any normal prison however.
12.title: Wendy Williams

choices: Wendy meekly does what the Brat asks.
She doesn't look that strong Wendy figures she can stand up to her.
121.content:
Wendy had survived one week so far. Normally she would just attach her self to the most powerful person in the prison for protection but in here that changed on a weekly bases. Worst the guards where no use at all unless you where trying to escape they didn’t care what you did or what happened to the other inmates. Fortunately she had a cell to her self for the first week though she was told if any more prisons came about she would have to share.

Early morning came and the cell doors all opened at once, she rushed out not wanting to be slow to the mess hall or one of the more disgusting villains may get there first. Fortunately the prison was still 90% normal prisoners but that didn’t make them any less dangerous. Wendy was still deciding if it was better to act tough or meek to get by them. The super villains however they where a huge problem.

Often they would have fights, take a prisoner for their own personal use. Sometimes they just got bored and decided the rest of the prisoners would make good sport. The guards did nothing to prevent this. After a day Wendy understood why as she walked past two guards mindlessly licking Footgirls feet in the mess hall.

Getting her food she sat down purposely at a crowded table with the queen of misfits Veronica Other. Veronica had a little gang of punk rock teenagers but the safety came in there where many of them so none knew if Wendy was all ready a member and in a moment she could just slip away. The punk queen’s table smelt awful of body odour but Wendy learned fast that a bad smell was the least of her problems here. Once sat she got out her little notebook.

She decided to start writing a survival guide for herself to get around the prison.

Exceptional dangerous subject 1:
Footgirl: real name yet to be determined.
Spends most of her time in the basement of the prison tinkering with technology. Have not had the courage to spy on her down there.
Preferences: Appears to prefer to torment men lucky for me. When bored she has them devout themselves to her feet.
Allies: None that I can tell.
Enemies: really seems to hate MegaButt.
If confronted: Try talking about science?
If hostile: Don’t run she seems fast on her little feet, try flattering her poor hygiene.
Comments: Little contact so far, lets keep it that way.

Her notebook was snatched up. Wendy looked to see Veronica the queen of misfits her self reading over her writing. Bringing her body odour with her.
“What’s this?”
“A survival guide I’m making for myself.” Wendy always believed the truth would set her free.
“Just one page?”
“I’ve only started today” and she wasn’t dumb enough to write about Veronica right next to her. Wendy’s eyes where starting to water from the body odour but she kept her calm face.
“Neat idea, what’s your name again?”
“Wendy.”
“Well Wendy,” She sniffed next to Wendy’s armpit. “Are you wearing deodorant?”
“Erm yes Ma’am”
“What the fuck! You don’t need deodorant to live that's just something the state wants you to think freedom smells like this” She presented her armpit to Wendy.
Wendy sighed, she knew this was bound to happen when you hide amongst these people. She closed her eyes moved her nose next to the reeking armpit and breathed in loud enough for Veronica to hear.
Veronica grabbed Wendy’s red hair with her free hand and jammed her head right into the armpit. The stench was awful an unwashed sweaty pit but at least it wasn’t one of the big villains pit’s.
After an entire minute she was finally released. Her face had sweat dripping down it, she was sure her entire face stank of BO now.
“That is the smell of independence. Don’t forget it.”
“Thank you Ma’am” Wendy said keeping her face unemotional.

After breakfast she avoided the exercise yard where Havoc had corned some unlucky prisoners. She was going to go to the library but the Duchess was making rounds there with her twins. Going to the showers she saw Sluggette messing with the pipes, the sight of her made Wendy’s blood boil. So Wendy just went back to her cell. This was dangerous as well yesterday Skunketee would jump into random open cells and spray the poor inmate lying there. You just had to take the chance today.

Evening came and as your door was supposed to close to guards approached with a very short prisoner. “Your cell mate” They said than eagerly left. The very short person walked in. Wendy gasped as she saw them, how could a mere child be sentenced to maximum security the poor thing must be so scared.
“Hello I’m Wendy are you okay.”
“I guess.” She shrugged.
“What happened why are you here?”
“Oh you know the people in this city just don’t understand quality television.”
“Wha-” She gasped at once recognising the child like person. “Oh no”
“So I’m Sue but most people know me as The Brat.” She smiled wickedly at you. “Now cell mate, some ground rules when I’m around you do not walk, you stay on your hands and knees. Second…
121.title: The not so fun house.

choices: The Brat has her escort her around.
Wendy can travel by her self today.
1212.content:
She looked like a child she couldn’t be much stronger. “No, this is my cell I’m going to stand.”
“Oh really? Look me in the eye and say that.”
She bent down to get on eye level but as soon as her mouth opened she lost her thoughts. Those eyes where so perfect, the wonderful blue circles. The way they swirled around like hypno discs.
“You want to sleep on the floor tonight.”
And she did the bed wasn’t for her but the floor that was so much more appealing. So much space to lie down on a nice hard surface to be secure against.
“Yeah” she said leaving her mouth open a little drool came down.
“You don’t want to talk.”
Wendy silently agreed. Talking was silly it would only get her into trouble.
“You want to change my wet nappy and wear the dirty one.”
She was starting to feel rather exposed in just her prison outfit an extra layer would be more comfortable. At once she changed the Brat’s wet diaper. The Brat laid down allowing Wendy to gently undo the elastic straps. Applying a new one to her, she carefully taped it up under her tummy. Wendy than lowered her pants and attached the old used diaper to herself. It made a crinkly noise when she moved and she could feel the wetness spread across her crotch but it felt right to wear it. Pulling her pants back up she finally felt secure.
“I can’t reach the bed, be my footstool.”
Wendy understood because the Brat was so short it was only good manners to kneel down and let her step on her back to reach the bed. Wendy just waited in that position in case her new cell mate needed to get down.
“Bed time, suck your thumb and go to sleep.” The Brat called from above. Wendy felt a sudden emptiness in her mouth, laying down she slowly moved her thumb to her mouth. She found it rather comforting to have her thumb in her mouth, slowly suckling upon it she drifted to sleep at peace.

Late in the night Wendy realised she was on the cold floor. Her mind raced to what happened, first she disgustedly removed her thumb, it was slobbered with saliva. She than slowly noticed a very itchy and uncomfortable feeling from her never regions. She groaned as she remembered the used diaper now tied to her waist. She was going to spend a lot of time in the shower in the morning.
Sighing She got out her guide and began writing under the moon light.

Exceptional dangerous subject 2:
The Brat: Sue unknown last name.
My new cell mate, will have frequent contact with. Has already dominated me. Seems to posses some kind of mind control powers, how is still unknown.
Preferences: enjoys making me act like a child and wear her used diaper. Has her own own child like behaviour as well.
Allies: Was once in an alliance with Duchess to brainwash the city.
Enemies: unknown.
If confronted: Submit she won’t hurt you only humiliate and the effects appear temporary.
If hostile: Do not challenge her authority.
Comments: My cellmate will try to build up a relationship so I can rest easy at night.

Wendy considered getting into the empty bed on the other side but thought that may lead to a confrontation in the morning so decided to just sleep on the floor. It was difficult with the filthy diaper attached to her rustling with every turn but she once again fell asleep.
She awoke to someone poking her. Looking up Wendy saw the child like villain, “change me,” she said.
“Can’t you change yourself?” Wendy said bitterly still waking her self up.
“I don’t need to, I have you. Now change me!”
Considering the consequences Wendy complied and once again had the Brat on the floor taking a wet nappy away and replacing it with a fresh clean one.
Wendy than went to change her own well used wet diaper.
“What do you think your doing?” Brat said watching her from the floor.
“Er changing my diaper, Miss?”
“Keep it on.” She said disinterested like she didn’t really care.
“Bu- can’t I-”
“For getting mouthy with me this morning. Keep it on.”
That was so unfair she only asked her question and it was right after getting woken up.

Wendy was in a foul mood when the doors all opened.
1212.title: New cell boss.

choices: It's the day of the election
13.content:
In a city of crime, one woman seeks to make a different. Her name is Maria Anderson, local politician running for mayor.

She stands at the height of 5'8 with long jet black hair that falls to her mid-back in length. She generally clothes herself in dark formal attire for her campaign events and rallies.

Her rise to political power began shortly after the dastardly Havoc launched a plan to destroy the city with the force of her BO alone, an attempt the Metropolis PD were helpless to stop. Only the intervention of Birdboy and Catgirl subdued her in time. This was followed shortly by the villainess FootGirl nearly coating the entire city in her toejam, covering an entire district before being stopped once again by Birdboy and Catgirl. It was clear to everyone at that point, that serious changes needed to be made in the city.

So Maria launched her political career, calling for an end to the cities dependence on Birdboy and Catgirl to save the day, advocating changes to the local Police Department that would make them better equipped to face the stinky villains of Metropolis. She also called for the construction of new, advanced prisons capable of holding even the smelliest of them without fear of frequent breakouts. Her ideas caught on, putting her neck and neck in the run against the longstanding mayor of Metropolis.

But this success came at a price, with her central issue being crime, she'd be bound to draw some unsavory attention. But she couldn't let this stop her! The city needed change and she'd be the one to do it!



Maria shook her head at the newspaper headlines. Yet again, the fiendish Braun Beatdown had gone on a crime spree, before being stopped by Catgirl. She lowered the paper and sighed. At the very least, this would help bolster her campaign numbers. With luck, she'd pull ahead of her opponent by at least a couple points. Now, what did she have scheduled for today?
13.title: Aspiring Politician

131.content:
With the election only a week away, holding another campaign rally would be paramount to insuring her success. She'd spread word all throughout the city that she'd be holding one in Metropolis city park, and sure enough, by the time she arrived, it'd already been filled to capacity. Maria joined her staff backstage where everyone was preparing for her big speech.

"Ah, Miss Anderson, glad you could make it." John Ross, her chief of staff, approached and held out his hand.

Maria returned the smile as she shook his hand. "I wouldn't miss it for the world. We seem to have gathered quite the crowd, think it'll be enough?"

John laughed cheerfully. "Certainly, our opponent can barely scrounge up a crowd half this size. If we keep up at this rate, claiming victory will be easy." He heard the crowd cheer again and smiled. "Now, I'd better get started on your introduction, good luck with your speech."

Maria stepped aside to let him pass, hearing a loud cheer go up from the crowd as he walked on stage. She took a deep breath and straightened her collar. One had to look the part to run for mayor.

"Excuse me, Miss Anderson!"

Maria's gaze turned to a young woman stumbling towards her, an intern, if she remembered correctly. "Can I help you Miss..."

"Amelia," the intern answered, brushing a few loose strands of her red hair aside. "I'm an intern, just signed on, and I need to tell you, I really don't think you should go through with this rally!"

Maria scoffed. "You want me to cancel my speech, after I've already arrived?" She shook her head and started walking away.

"Please, wait!" Amelia ran in front of her and held up her hand. "What if one of the villains shows up? I don't think you have enough security here to-"

"It'll be fine," Maria insisted, pushing past her and stepping out onto the stage.

Amelia bit her lip as she watched her go, praying her hunch wasn't right.

Maria walked out to the applause of the crowd, stopping to shake John's hand before approaching the podium. "Good people of Metropolis! Our city has long since suffered under the thumb of dastardly villains, who've terrorized this fair city with the power of their stink alone." She began in a solemn tone to invoke the right mood. "The Metropolis Police Department has been overwhelmed and under equipped to handle these new and ever multiplying threats. It is only through the efforts of Birdboy and Catgirl that this city hasn't already fallen."

The crowd murmured their agreements. There seemed to some sort of confusion near the entrance, but it wasn't large enough to disrupt anything.

"But that will all soon change," Maria continued. Her tone rising to inspire confidence and courage. "When I'm elected, I will bring about the changes this city needs to overcome these threats! Soon our Police Department will no longer be helpless in the face of these villains, and once they're captured, they'll remained locked away for good!"

The roar or victory from the crowd quickly faded into mumbles of confusion as all heads turned towards the park entrance. Where someone was pushing their way to the front.

Maria furrowed her eyebrows. Who could possibly be disturbing her rally?
131.title: A campaign rally

1313.content: Was it Hippo Girl or The Cougar?
1313.title: Another villain

choices: Wait for the police to arrive
13133.content:
Shouldering their way past the crowd and bringing forth the stink of unwashed pits came Alysa.
Alysa the leader of the Fifth street filth gang. Her and her all girl gang where considered an annoyance and nuisance to the new clean city.
The crowd parted covering their noses from her reeking body odour, she marched straight ahead making a beeline for Maria. Maria stood her ground against this unwanted intrusion not even twitching as the malodorous biker stood just before her stage.

“Just what the fuck do you think your doing!” Alysa shouted to her crossing her arms in front of her.
“Forgive me, I have not had the pleasure of making your acquaintance.” Maria said keeping calm in the face of this aggressor with her finger subtly on her silent alarm.
“Can it you prim and proper bitch. I just heard about this ‘remodelling’ 5th street. Thats my fucking turf! You don’t fuck with my turf, turn it in to some kind of 50s housewife bakery.”
“I think you will find the remodelling of outdated and under repaired areas will have an exceptional increase in living standards.”
Maria kept Alysa attention towards her allowing some of her bodyguards to move in closer.
“Oh I’m not having any of that you soap smelling prudes touch my street.”
As the first security guard went to grab her arm she easily dodged him, in one quick motion she had him under her stinking pits and unconscious. The second guard leaped into action only for Alysa to turn towards him and unleash a horrendous burp into his face. The poor man became a sputtering wreck as he fell to the floor gasping.

Maria pressed the silent alarm on her suit. Keep her talking keep her away from the crowd.
“Stop this at once! If you want attention than you have it but don’t think I will stand by and let you terrorize the people of this great city.”
The people in the audience panicked all trying to escape. “Where do you think your fan clubs goin?” Sneered Alysa.
A lot of different rumbling sounds where coming from outside. Oh no, Maria knew that sound.
Dozens of motorcycles crashed stormed into the park.
“So this is how its going to go.” Alysa said walking up the stage to Maria. “You are going to tell this crowd that your pulling out the election, than your going to crawl over here and kiss my butt.”
“Absurd.”
“If you don’t my gangs going to go nuts on this crowd hmm starting with that one.” She said pointing to Amelia, her newest intern, who had just been caught between two bikers. The bikers where laughing at her tying a rope around her waist.
Get used to this, these villains won’t stop when you are mayor just keep calm and deal with them. Maria thought to herself.
13133.title: Fifth street filth gang.

131331.content:
"I'm sure someones called the police by now, they must be on their way." Of all the villains in Metropolis that couldn't be stopped by the police, the Fifth street filth gang weren't among them. If Maria could stall them long enough they'd be scared away by the police. She remained standing in a poised manner. "Aggravating me now will only make things worse for you in the future."

Alysa scoffed. "Yeah, and messing with us will make things worse in the now." She nodded at Samantha who promptly stuffed Amelia's face in her pit, causing the intern to let out a high pitched squeal as she struggled to escape.

Maria winced on her behalf. Whatever college credit she was getting from this, definitely wasn't worth it. She made a show of scoffing and turning away. "Oh, enough! Actions like this are precisely why I decided to run in the first place! Do you think proving my point will make me drop out?"

Alysa grinned in a devious fashion. "Oh, you telling me you don't care about your little friend?"

Maria stiffened at her words. "Of course I care," she said indignantly. "I care about protecting her, and the rest of this city. It's why I'm running, and why I won't let myself be bullied into submission by a group of has been criminals."

Alysa's eyes widened. "Has been criminals!?" Her surprise faded into rage. "You're going to regret saying that you prissy bitch!"

Maria bit her tongue. Perhaps she could be a little too brave sometimes. She drummed her fingers against the podium, praying that the police arrived soon.

"Give them a taste of your stink girls!" Alysa called over.

All at once the Fifth street filth gang ran amok in the crowd, grabbing whoever they could. Stuffing people into their pits or sitting and farting on them with their butts. Others were rendered unconscious from loud belches, which was probably a blessing considering how the air itself was starting to grow thick with stink.

Maria watched the scene unfold from the stage. Suppressing her horror as best she could. "What do I do?" She noticed Samantha free Amelia from her pits, only to grab her and force her onto her knees.

Amelia's eyes widened. "No, ple-" Before she could finish her face was shoved straight into the gangsters rear. Where she promptly released a barrage of gas on the helpless girl. Who could only scream and flail.

Maria took a couple steps toward them before she stopped herself. "There's nothing I can do now, I'm no fighter!" She chewed on her lip anxiously. Promising to make it up to the poor girl later. She glanced at the crowd, who seemed equally horrified by the turn of events.

"Just drop out!" a panicked citizen yelled.

"No, don't give in!" another cried.

If it was any consolation, the crowd seemed as divided on what to do as she was. Maria turned back to Alysa. "Stop this at once!"

Alysa snorted. "Yeah, or what?" She stalked toward her. "You can't win the election while sniffing the exhaust of my motorcycle!"

"Oh crap."
131331.title: Wait for the police to arrive

choices: A hero comes to the rescue.
1313311.content:
Chaos was erupting in the crowds as the bikers had their way with easy victims. Poor Amelia was still being used by the sadistic Samantha. The large biker Amber was driving around a supersized motorbike spraying crowds in a green gas.

Maria however was focused on the biker approaching her, Alysa was practically licking her lips in anticipation. She backed up to her podium as the stench of body odour came close with Alysa rising up the steps taking her time to reach the poor mayor candidate.
Her head was buzzing with sounds, high pitched loud sounds. Sirens? More and more came making Alysa stop and look at the nearby road. Sure enough several police cars sped towards the park.
Oh thank god.

Police cars quickly stopped setting up a barricade by the park. Officers flooded out guns drawn at the biker gals in the park. The bikers stopped having their fun as the police got their attention.
Alysa whistled and her biker gals each took up their own human shield. Maria was quickly dragged into Alysa reeking body as she was held by the gross leader against her will.
“Call them off or I’m ganna make you suffer.”
“Just stop,” Maria said between strained gasps. “Let the people go” gasp “and we can solve this dispute.” Gasp “Between us.” Maria felt that bargaining might win over this woman, she could after all pull strings to lighten her sentence.
One of the officers was on a megaphone as his forces spread out to cover the area. “Attention everyone, this is the MPD we have area secured. Release your captives at once.”
Oh shes not going to take threats well.
“Oh fuck that noise.” She put her phone to her ear, causing her armpit to be exposed releasing its horrendous odour onto Maria. “Sally fuck em up. We need an exit.”
“What?”
“Like I would keep my gals in one place.” She said smugly.

More engines where coming from beyond the streets. Maria looked on in worry as dozen more bikers came behind the police cruisers. More chaos followed. Some police fired rubber bullets off into the gang making them crash but far more made it to their line and attacked them.
“Lets go gals!”
The bikers in the crowd got on their bikes some carrying hostages with them, Maria noticed Amelia was among them. “Leave them alone!”
“Oh don’t worry your joining them, your coming with me.”
The muscled biker easily man handled the smaller Maria towards her bike. Rubber bullets went in every direction some bikers got hit hard enough to keep them down but most where un touched as they ran amok around. Alysa snapped a handcuff over one of Maria hands and the other cuff to her bike. “Might want to hold on tight sweet cheeks.” She taunted.
“Okay girls where breaking their line and going back home.”
“This is insane! You have to understand this can’t end well for you! They know where you live they won’t give up. Stop now I can help you. I can help everyone in this city you just have to let me.”
She must be able to see that!
“Nice, very nice ready to go?” She said getting on her bike as Maria was still left standing attached to it.
1313311.title: The Police Arrive

13133112.content:
Maria squeezed her eyes shut as Alysa revved up her engine. A line of bikers on each side of them preparing to do the same. All the while rubber bullets flew in every direction. Though none of the cops fired at any of the bikes with hostages on them. "This isn't good!"

Alysa leaned forward and chuckled. "Alright girls, let's burn rubber!"

"Not so fast!"

Maria gritted her teeth. "Oh God, this better not be another villain." She grimaced at the thought of another interrupting. Especially one of the stronger ones like Goth Goddess or FootGirl.

A smoke bomb fell and enveloped the area in smoke. A silhouette sprang into the fray and started taking bikers down left and right. Until only Alysa and Samantha remained. When the smoke cleared none other than the heroine Catgirl stood in their path. She struck a heroic pose. "Sorry." She lightly tapped the nearest bike with her foot, causing a domino effect that knocked all the bikes down. "But it looks like you just burned out."

Maria tried not to cringe at the awful one-liner.

"You bitch!" Alysa drove straight at her. Holding her arm out to catch and stuff the heroine into her sweaty armpit.

Catgirl ducked underneath her arm and grabbed onto Maria, swinging herself onto the back of the motorcycle. "Mind if I hitch I ride?" She wrapped one arm around Maria to keep herself from falling.

"Not at all," Maria answered.

Alysa blinked. "What the, hey! Get off my ride!" She swerved violently to the left and right.

Catgirl maintained her balance as she produced a small gadget from her belt. "Hang on!" She slipped it into Maria's handcuffs and twisted it once.

Maria felt the cuffs fall off her wrists at once. She smiled in relief. "You did it!"

Alysa frowned. "You want out, fine, have a nice fall!" She raised her butt to eye level with them and farted straight into their faces.

Maria barely took a whiff before being overwhelmed. "Oh God!" It had to be the worst thing she'd ever smelled. She leaned back into the heroine as dizziness overtook her.

Catgirl tightened her grip. "I got you!" She pulled out her grappling hook and shot backward, hooking onto a low hanging tree branch. Allowing them both to swing off the back of Alysa's motorcycle.

Maria and Catgirl both rolled to a stop beneath the tree. Maria sat up. "Ugh, not the most, graceful of landings. Especially not a cat." She rubbed her head. Watching at the cycles came around for another run.

Catgirl shrugged. "It's either that or staying on the cycle."

"On second thought, I'll take it." Maria glanced at her. "By the way, how did you handle that horrible stench so well?"

Catgirl scratched the back of her head and laughed. "You could say I've, built up an immunity over time."

"I can imagine."

Samantha drove straight at them from the right. "I'm taking you down!"

Maria found herself pushed out of the way by Catgirl, where she fell on her butt. "Not the most graceful of heroines in general, actually."

Catgirl dodged Samantha's attack and repeated the same motion as before. Grabbing onto Amelia and swinging herself onto the back of the motorcycle. Freeing the terrified intern before grappling to safety. She landed near the same tree. "Here you go miss." She set Amelia down next to Maria. "Stay here until it's safe!"

Amelia could do little beyond nodding her head.

Catgirl took a deep breath before leaping back into the fray. The police joining in now that the hostages were safe.

Maria glanced at her intern. Trying to think of something to say. "I, guess you were right." She watched Catgirl tackle Samantha off her bike and start grappling with her. Wincing sympathetically as the heroine's face was stuffed in the gangsters armpit.

Amelia stared at her blankly.

Catgirl broke free and wrestled Samantha onto the ground where she cuffed her. Taking the opportunity to let out another (no doubt cringe-worthy) one-liner. Before she turned her attention to helping the cops take down Alysa.

"About the villains, I mean," Maria blurted out. She cleared her throat. "I should've listened. Sorry."

Amelia hugged herself. "It's fine, I mean, I doubt you would've gone up there if you thought anything like this would happen. What I'm trying to say is, forget about it."

"Augh!" Alysa fell off her bike, onto her back. Catgirl landed on top of her. One heroic quip later and the gang leader was also in cuffs. The weary crowd together with the police cheered and applauded. Within minutes reporters flooded the area to hound Catgirl with cameras and microphones. Asking question upon question, only some of which were related to the topic at hand.

Maria rose and dusted herself off. Relieved that the whole ordeal ended without her or anyone else being dragged off.

"Miss Anderson!" a series of reporters swarmed over to her. "What do you have to say about today's incident!"

"Was your security under prepared?"

"Do you still plan to renovate Fifth Street?"

"Uh," Maria trailed off at all the questions. Usually she was pretty good at handling the media. But being farted on, manhandled and nearly kidnapped by a gang leader made her feel a little disoriented.

"Please, everyone!" John Ross stepped between her and the reporters. "Miss Anderson's had a long day, she'll answer all questions at tomorrow's press conference!"

Maria sighed in relief. Now all that remained was to see what the rest of the day held, or the next day at that. Something told her it was going to be a long campaign...
13133112.title: A hero comes to the rescue.

choices: Someone is in her home with her.
Someone has already come and gone from her home.
131331121.content:
Maria sat on her comfortable sofa. After her ordeal all she wanted was nice hot shower and some time to herself. Sitting in her pyjamas and a bath robe she lazily watched the news. Naturally it was covering the attack on her, Catgirl was receiving heaps of praise and the police where being condemned for their lack of control. Than came the over opinionated nosey journalists ‘speculating’ if this would spell and end to Maria’s campaign for mayor.
She listened for some time at the news casters. “A sever lack of discipline has allowed these villains to run amok with no regard for the law abiding citizens of our city.”
“Yet what can Miss Anderson hope to accomplish? She proved quite unable to defuse the attack today.”
“In fact you could say she was sat on her behind,” Maria glared at the telvision. “while the true hero of the city acted. Is this what we can expect from our candidate? Someone who is hapy to sit back and let others suffer to pull her out of her own messes?”

The television started showing shots of her falling on her butt, being dragged around by that gross biker Alysa. Clearly the media enjoyed the idea of her being humiliated than showing her speech earlier. Regardless her approval ratting was up. People in the crowd returned to their families to tell how the city needed better police.
Polls where showing a dissatisfaction with the current mayors cuts to law enforcement. Something Maria could pounce on in the upcoming debate. Honestly this attack was a blessing, if some low life’s like the fifth street would dare attack citizens in broad daylight, well it only showed how far the city had fallen.

Amelia had been given the week of, she hoped she would come back but understood if today’s event had been too much for her. Her assistant John was preparing her best responses for her debate. So she had nothing to worry about for the evening just a chance to put her feet up and relax.
It had been several hours since her little ordeal but she felt more ready than ever to take on the city and drag it into the modern age. Picking through her campagin folder she looked through her renovation, anti corruption log, her new budgets. Strangely she felt like parts of it where missing. Maybe John took some with him and forgot to tell me.

Walking to her kitchen counter for a hot cup of coffee she noticed an odd smell in the air. It wasn’t there when she came in this afternoon. It was a stale odd smell. Turning on the ventilation she hopped it would remove it before the morning.
Going by the front door she froze. The lock was undone, she always locked her door after coming in. She immediately went up to it and re applied the lock only for her hand to touch something sticky on the lock. She rushed over to the bathroom and used her multiple soaps to try to clean her hand of the sticky gunk on her. Someone’s been in my home! They must of come in when she was in the shower but who? She rushed into her bedroom closing the door behind her, she grabbed her phone and called the police.
131331121.title: Later that day

1313311211.content:
"Hello, this is Maria Anderson, I think there's someone in my home." Maria glanced over her shoulder. She hadn't hired any security, it never seemed necessary since she lived in a safe part of town. Perhaps she should've thought about it after deciding to run for mayor. She finished making the call and put the phone down. The operator instructed her to get out of the house and wait for them. Sounded like a good idea to her.

She slipped out of her bedroom. Trying to look at nonchalant as possible. Hoping that wouldn't alert the intruder that she was onto them. Maybe if they were a simple burglar they'd let her leave. "But then again, what kind of burglar leaves gunk like that attached to my door. And why would they steal my campaign files? I really hope it's not another villain." There weren't many villains that liked to act subtle. Most were loud and upfront about who they were and what they wanted. Which made her fear which one it might be.
1313311211.title: Someone is in her home with her.

choices: The Cougar, Hippo Girl, or another villain
13133112112.content: Who was it then? MegaButt, Foot Girl, The Cougar, Hippo Girl? Or somebody else?
13133112112.title: Which villain?

choices: We are going for a walk.
131331121121.content:
Acting nonchalant was difficult, They must of seen me run to wash my hands, if there still here. She went back towards her front door. Just a normal everyday woman going outside in her pyjamas. Once at the door the odour was more clear, foot odour.
She felt her skin tingle at the idea. Reaching for the door handle a voice spoke behind her. “Isn’t it a little late to be going for a walk?”
Maria spun around to look at the intruder.
Oh no.

Standing in her lounge area was a big footed short woman. Footgirl. A dozen questions entered Maria’s head Why is she here? What does she want? How did she get in?
“Er,”
“You and I need to talk.” she said moving closer.
“The police are on their way.” Maria took a stand. She could get this woman to leave.
“Well we will deal with that later.” She said moving insufferably closer. Brining a pungent foot smell with her.
“If you wish to discuss something you can find me in my office during working hours Miss. As for now I must ask you to leave my home.”
“Or?”
“Ah the police-”
“Aren't here right now” She said completely calmly.
“Ah-” keep her talking stall for time, if shes talking shes not doing anything to you.
“Now I couldn’t help notice my boyfriend has been paying a lot of attention to you.”
“Boy friend? You broke into my home to discuss relationship issues?!”
“Yes Jake Blackridge. Has been very interested in you.”
The billionaire boy? Maria vaguely remembered meeting him after he donated a large sum to her campaign.
Before another though came to her Footgirl pounced. In a short scuffle the black belt martial artist Footgirl had easily subdued Maria.
“Now I’m not a jealous girl but it seems to me that if Jake is going to neglect me I have to do something to get his attention.”
“This is insane ju-mhmm” A dirty well worn sock was shoved into Maria mouth. She could taste the days old sweat coming from it.
“Now, now listen closely.
131331121121.title: Footgirl enters the campaign.

1313311212.content:
Maria scanned the bedroom for anything she might use as a weapon. Somehow, she didn't think a bottle of perfume would be quite enough to defend herself against the city's smelliest super villains... suddenly, her eyes happened upon something out of place. "911, what's your emergency?" the operator's voice ringed in her ear. But the sight of the tape recorder, resting patiently on her bed, overwhelmed Maria's instinct to reply. She felt almost hypnotized by the object.

"911, can you hear me?" Maria hung up. Whoever left the tape was miles away, by now. There was really only one thing to do: listen what they had to say. She took a deep breath, and hit play. A sultry woman's voice pierced the silence of her bedroom. "Good evening, Miss Anderson. I've been following your campaign... very closely, indeed. I hope you don't mind me taking some notes from your campaign folder - Amelia here hasn't done a very good job of explaining your policy." Maria's heart sank as muffled cries turned into desperate gasps. "Miss Anderson! Please... *gasp* send help! *cough* I can't take the smell much longer..."

"Now, now, what a miserable intern you have, Miss Anderson. But if you don't want to see her choking on my toes live on stream, I suggest you come meet me by the old shoe factory in the next hour. I'm eager to give some feedback on your platform. And just in case you have any ideas... I have contacts up and down the chain of command. You try to get the coppers involved, I will know. And so will the thousands of people tuning in to see Amelia get tortured. Tick tock, Miss Anderson, tick tock!"

As the tape finished playing, rage, fear and desperation all filled Maria's heart. Hands shaking, she cracked into her stash. If the people knew what kind of pills she was hiding under the bed, her campaign would be over in a minute. As the drugs seeped into her bloodstream, Maria's courage was reinvigorated. She'd already put hundreds of lives at stake earlier that day - she was not about to let anyone else get hurt. She was going to get dressed, and she was going to meet whoever sent her that dreadful message!

Maria had listened to countless interviews and interrogations with the city's most dangerous super villains while doing her research. With a voice like that, she knew it could only be...
1313311212.title: Someone has already come and gone from her home.

choices: Footgirl is waiting for her in the shadows beyond
Footgirl is nowhere to be found!
13133112121.content:
Footgirl. Perhaps the biggest menace to Metropolis and her people. Maria had called for the construction of a fully-automated, biocontainment facility just to hold her - and now that Footgirl was trying to rattle her cage, she was ready to double down on the project.

Her tight campaign schedule had taught Maria how to groom herself in virtually seconds. Before long, she was back in her trademark suit and black pumps, grabbing her car keys out of the bowl and driving down the city's waterfront, to meet one of its most dangerous villains in her home turf: the abandoned Tootsie Co. factory. It was once the country's largest footwear manufacturer, long since bankrupt. Renovating the industrial complex was another of Maria's policies, which (she hoped) would root out one of the worst criminal hot spots in the area. For now, it was home to smugglers, drug dealers, and of course, Footgirl.

Maria parked her car as close as possible to the loading bay doors, positioned ideally for a quick get-away. Her heart was pounding as she stepped out into the cold midnight air. Maria knew she was almost certain not to make it. At least, not in shape for next week's debate. But for Amelia, she had to do what she had to do. She put on her big girl face, and took a confident step toward Footgirl's lair.

The ocean breeze carried the distinct smell of raw sewage, probably the perfidious work of some other villain, but even that wasn't enough to mask the thick scent of Limburger cheese which lingered inside the factory. The loading bay was stacked to the ceiling with rotten crates, thousands of unsold running shoes spilling into the aisles to serve as nests for the countless mice lured in by the stench. There was a single light in the middle of the warehouse, beckoning her to advance, deeper into the bowels of Tootsie Co.

This was it. Point of no return. Maria took a deep breath, before moving into the light.
13133112121.title: Footgirl!

131331121212.content:
Upon stepping into the circle of light, Maria scanned the darkness for any sign of Footgirl. But alas, beyond the skittering and jittering of the rats, she seemed to be completely alone in the warehouse. Could it be this was some kind of sick joke? An ill-conceived prank? Or maybe even a lousy attempt at intimidation... whatever the case, she wasn't going to stick around in an abandoned factory, waiting for an actual criminal to waltz in. She turned on her heel and *OWW*!

Maria yelped in pain as an excruciatingly sharp object landed on the back of her neck. And it seemed to be... moving?! "What the..." She reached for the site of the sting, and her heart stopped upon feeling the small, many-legged metal creature that was stuck to her neck. "I wouldn't mess with that, if I were you." a familiar voice echoed through the noisy factory loudspeakers. "Footgirl!" Maria growled, soldiering through the pain.

The maniacal giggles of the stinky-footed villain resonated through the empty building. "Well, aren't we the clever sweat-rag? Teehee!" Like a true psychopath, the cold and calculating tone of her tape was completely replaced with a sadistic, over-the-top inflection. "I demand you show yourself at once! A-and take this fucking thing off me!" Maria was trying her best to seem fierce, but deep down, true fear was settling in. And it showed.

"Oh well, Miss Mayor McPants, I demand you KNEEL!" In a moment of pure horror, Maria felt a debilitating zap in the back of her neck, and 90% of the muscles on her body going limp. Falling heavy on her knees, the distressed politician could utter but a few words before running out of breath. "... just... let... Amelia... go!" More mad laughter followed, only interrupted by a coughing fit worthy of a cartoon villain. "Don't worry, sweetheart - I will. You see, Amelia was only the appetizer. You, my dear, are the main course!"

Maria's heart sank even more. Of course it was a trap. What else did she expect? "F-fine... torture me... ya bitch!" she managed to spit, along with a lot of drool from her slack mouth. "Torture? Nooo... nothing so crass! We're gonna play a little game, you and I... and thousands of fans watching us on YouTube. That's right, honey, we're live!" From the corner of her eye, Maria could only just recognize the flashing red light from the camera mounted on one of the service catwalks.

"You see, the true reason I wanted to lure you here wasn't politics. I could brainwash the entire town into voting for me, if I really wanted! Truth is, I've been working on a little, hmm... challenge course, not for the weak of stomach. And I needed someone special to play with. You handled yourself pretty well with those bikers. If 'pretty well' means making a fool of yourself, of course! But hey - humiliation sells! Isn't that right, guys? Remember to smash that like button and subscribe for more -"

"I'm not going to play none of your sick games, Footgirl!" Maria interrupted, as her muscles slowly regained function. "Well, aren't you forgetting something? Do I need to get your minion on the phone again?" "... M-miss Anderson... please... p-please..." the broken voice of the intern echoed softly through the loudspeakers. Damn it, she couldn't abandon Amelia now!

"And besiiiides... what's that little bug on your neck? Oh, silly me, it's just happens to contain a supersaturated solution of my foot sweat, ready to be injected into your spinal cord at any time I please. It would instantly lobotomize you... even more than you're already are, of course! Though slightly more addicted to my stinky feet. Not very good for your polling numbers, I bet. So don't even think of disobeying me, bitch! How's it gonna be, then? Ready to play?"

Maria sighed, not with fear, but with resignation.
131331121212.title: Footgirl is nowhere to be found!

choices: He goes to search for the emergency generator
He goes to try contact Bird Boy and Cat Girl
He tries to barricade himself in his office.
He arms himself to try and detain the inmates on his own
14.content:
With large array of supervillains that infested the great city of Metropolis, it only stood to reason that there would be a facility built to accommodate them once they've been successfully apprehended. The Metropolis Correctional Facility (or the MCF as it was more commonly known), was designed with such a goal in mind. Fitted with the most advanced security system that money could buy, the institution was more than capable of housing and monitoring the many super powered beings that were brought their way. The primary investor of the institution, Jake Blackridge, hoped that it would also be a place for the criminally insane to be rehabilitated and make into productive members of society.

Unfortunate for him, this was not to be. Not long after creating the facility, a man by the name of Ian Johnston took the reigns, having been personally appointed by Blackridge himself. While he was a noble, selfless man of principals, he wasn't as attentive as he could've been. Incidents happened in an almost constant basis, ranging from breakouts to prison riots. Desperate to have order in his prison, Ian turned the reigns over to his eldest son Ralph, appointing him as head of security who promised to bring in some much needed discipline.

And he did just that. In less than two months the hungry young instituted changes that saw a dramatic decline in misconduct and a sharp increase in inmate compliance. Noteworthy troublemakers such as Havoc, Footgirl and Megabutt were forced into a state of begrudging obedience under his watch. It was these results that made him a hero among the citizens of Metropolis.

It wasn't hard to see why so many people thought highly of Ralph. He was a lithe man of diminutive stature, standing only 5'5, with a youthful face and light blue eyes. Initially, the public scoffed at the idea that someone so scrawny and meek looking could prove effective in keeping such dangerous criminals in check. That said, what the young man lacked in appearance he more than made up for in his intellect and wit. He was quick to charm his detractors with a lighthearted, self-deprecating humor, often poking fun at his height to the amusement of others.

On top of his affable nature, he was also seen as even handed and kindly to those who would take the time to see his handiwork. Three weeks into his hiring, he gave a tour of the facility with several news outlets hanging off his every word. They were blown away to see vile criminals such as Miss Manure and Amazon in their cells, engaging in recreational activities in such a way that one could be excused for believing that they were just normal everyday citizens.

The closest thing to an incident came when the mischievous Nasty Neko attempted to lure a journalist away from the group. Ralph was quick to spot this and sternly lectured Neko about prisoner conduct, threatening to take away his television privileges for a week should he get into any trouble. Truly, it was an amazing sight to see the bold and independent Neko slink back and meekly apologize before heading back to his cell. With results like that, how could they not help but hold the bright eyed security manager in high regard?

All that said, they had little idea of Ralph's true nature. All his life he had been looked down on for his small size. His classmates mocked and bullied him, his coworkers thought little of him and his father saw him as unfit to follow in his footsteps due to his physical shortcomings. With society pressing down on him constantly, he dedicated all his time into improving his mind rather than his body. He learned how to best people using nothing but his keen wit and intellect, and while he did eventually manage to earn the respect that had been denied to him for so long, by then it was too late.

While on the surface he seemed sociable and friendly, it was merely a mask that hid his true contempt for his fellow man. He had long since concluded that everyone around him, regardless of how much they insisted otherwise, was secretly mocking him for his size. This bred a fierce napoleon complex that would manifest whenever he was put in a position of authority. It brought him a great deal of joy and satisfaction to torment those unfortunate enough to work under him. His cruelty would often go unnoticed however, mostly in part to his unassuming appearance and the amiable persona he had perfected.

One would think that even he would hesitate to push his weight around in a facility filled with the most dangerous criminals in the city, but they'd be wrong. Each inmate was fitted with a strength dampening collar, as well as a deodorizing jumpsuit that would kill any potent stenches that they could potentially weaponize. Without their abilities, they were as vulnerable as the average human and thus, were subject to Ralph's cruel treatment.
'
Every morning would begin with a gushing torrent of freezing cold soap water shot out from a fire hose. After their "bath" the inmates were brought to the yard where they were forced to do backbreaking labor, from pulling giant stone slabs back and forth without rest, to digging holes only to fill them back up again. It was wise not to inquire as to the purpose of these activities, lest one wished to be hosed down for "undermining authority". After working in the yard, they were brought inside where they would eat the most heinous slop imaginable. Afterwards they would be sent back to their cells and allowed to waste time watching television or reading before the time came for them to go to bed. Anyone caught up and about would be subjected to another hosing.

For those with hyperactive libido's like Hippo Girl and Nasty Neko, imprisonment under Ralph's rule was nothing short of hellish. They were forced to wear a chastity belt that kept them from getting intimate with other inmates -- or themselves. To make it even more painful, their television screen were set to broadcast pornographic channels 24/7. The incident which helped cement the public's approval of Ralph, the one in which he "saved" a reporter from Nasty Neko was the result of his inhuman treatment. The tortured cat boy had approached the frightened reporter, pleading for him to relieve him. So desperate was Neko that he was entirely willing to be used like a cheap whore just so he could finally get some release.

His was a life that many inmates were forced to live under Ralph Johnston. There was a distinct pleasure he felt in using such high profile criminals as his playthings. The feeling of superiority he felt as they hung their heads low in an attempt to avoid eye contact with him was nothing short of intoxicating. Truly, this was a job that was made for someone like him; a job in which he could lord his power over those who had once lorded their power over others.

His dream job wouldn't last however, as karma has a habit of catching up with the wicked of heart, even when they're doing evil onto other evildoers. The pint sized terror sat in his office with mug of coffee in hand, humming to himself as his eyes scanned the security monitors in front of him. Things seemed to be running smoothly as the inmates sat quietly in their cells in anticipation of the buzzer that would signal the guards to come and escort them out to the yard. Their good behavior greatly displeased Ralph as he drummed his fingers along his desk irritably. As much as he enjoyed toying with them, he still maintained some meager level of professionalism in that he only acted out once they've done something to initiate it. Granted, he was quite fickle and pedantic in what he would punish them for, but it was the only principal he abode by.

"You'll slip up sooner or later, you little punks..." he muttered to himself as he stood up from his chair to ready himself for the day ahead.

Suddenly, it happened. Something that Ralph never once thought to prepare for. Just as he reached for the knob to exit his office, the lights began to flicker. He wasn't grant much time to process what was happening before the he was standing in near total darkness. In the months he had been working there he couldn't recall a single time when the power went out, though he wasn't the type to look into the details of his position that he found uninteresting, such as paperwork and maintenance.

As he tried to find his way in the dark, he heard heard his walkie talkie buzzing at his hip.

"Johnston! Are you there?! We have a really big problem right now!" A voice cried from the other end.

"I know, the lights are out. Just fix it and get back to work" Ralph stated coldly.

"I-It's not just the lights! The building is completely without power! The collars are have shorted out and the inmates are on the loose! I repeat, the inmates are on the loose!"

A nervous sweat trickled down Ralph's cheek and for the first time since he was in middle school, he felt helpless and uncertain. Taking in a deep breath, he collected himself and held the walkie talkie back up to his mouth.

"Alright, lets try to keep our heads on our shoulders. Where is the emergency generator?"

There was no response on the other end save for the light hum of static. Ralph growled and shook the device in his hand.

"I said, where is--"

"I heard you the first time" An unfamiliar voice spoke from the other end. "It really doesn't make a difference. I'll find you before you come anywhere near it, and then we're going to have a little talk about my present living conditions"

Ralph's eyes widened and his blood ran cold as he heard a sickening crunch on the other end before all he could hear on the other end was white noise. One thing was certain, whomever it was on the other end was obviously one of the inmates with a vendetta against him. Fear overwhelmed him as he tried to think of his next course of action.
14.title: Ralph Johnston, Corrupt Prison Guard

143.content:
"Inmate with a vendetta against him" didn't exactly narrow down the list of potential suspects. Just about every single inmate in the prison had something, or many things, against him! For all he knew, whoever was on the line was just one member of an entire angry mob of villains headed his way! And that might not have even been the worst of Ralph's troubles! The fact that the emergency generator hadn't come on by itself was troubling in its own right, but the weather forecast had shown clear skies all week! There was no way the power could have just "gone out" in the area like this. The both of these things together made Ralph absolutely certain that the building's power had been sabotaged. However, Ralph had no clue as to who or why. It couldn't have been one of the inmates, as they had all been accounted for last night. He supposed it could have been one of the few villains who had thus far either eluded capture or had proved themselves too difficult to capture like Waft or any of the Ancient villains. That explanation still didn't make much sense though. Why would they go out of their way to free the other villains when their competition had been reduced by at least ninety percent because of this place!?

Neither explanation made much sense to Ralph, and both were equally terrifying. Either one of the inmates had managed to somehow bypass all of the prison's security measures to kill the power, or there was at least one overly-powerful villain running amok in the place amongst all the other freed villains! The fear and uncertainty of the situation was too much to bear. He didn't dare step outside the room! Luckily, the warden's office was designed to act as a safe room. There was only one entry point, and it was behind a heavy, metal door. He just had to stay in his office, and wait for help to arrive! There was no need to...

Ralph froze up in terror when he heard a metallic clunking sound. It wasn't the door either! That's when Ralph looked up, and saw the one fatal flaw with his little office bunker. The vent. Normally, the vents were electrified in order to keep anyone from getting into them, but with the power out, there was nothing stopping the inmates from crawling through them!

Ralph looked on, paralyzed in fear as the vent grate clattered to the ground, and out of the vent came...
143.title: He tries to barricade himself in his office.

choices: One of the desperately horny inmates!
1432.content:
Ralph's eyes were stuck open in fear as he stared at the vent grate that had fallen to the ground in front of him. He was sure, someone was going to crawl through that opening and attack him! Any moment now. Any...moment? Ralph blinked, wondering why nothing had happened. No inmates seemed to be crawling out of the vents, and no rescuers were either for that matter! Just, the vent was opened and then...nothing!

Ralph sat frozen in his seat for a good five minutes before he finally worked up the courage to stand up. He cautiously walked over to the vent grate and picked it up. The grate hadn't been unscrewed, just struck so hard that it had been torn from the vent! "Who in the hell would go through the trouble of smashing this withou-GAHK!"

The grate clattered to the ground once more as Ralph held his throat with both hands. He dropped to his knees and started choking on the sudden rancid reek that filled the air! He couldn't even describe the atrocious stench that surrounded him! All he knew was that it was awful! Too awful!

"S...someone...h-help..m-m...eeeeeee..." Were his last words before everything went dark. The smell was just too bad! Ralph woke up some time later, tied to a chair in one of the cells! He wasn't left to wonder about who captured him for long, as he was soon greeted by...
1432.title: An absolutely horrific stench!

choices: Hippo Girl gives Ralph an aromatic tour of her body.
14321.content:

Scott was an 18 year old senior in high school, without much going for him, socially. Scott was often picked on throughout his school career, for the fact that he was generally much smaller and weaker than everyone around him. He only stood around 5'8, without any sort of muscle mass to speak of. He was skinny, and had a hard time putting on any sort of weight, fat or muscle. This made him into an easy target for bullies. Scott found solace from his not so wonderful life in comic books, more specifically, the adventures of his local superheroes, Birdboy and Catgirl. He considered himself to be their biggest fan, and often went about collecting any sort of merchandise he could get his hands on, of the vigilantes that kept Metropolis safe. He even went so far as to start a fan club for the heroes, which meets every Thursday night. Scott always wondered what it would be like to step into their shoes...


Well, he's about to find out, because apparently, some Villains thought a good way to get to the heroes was to go after their biggest fan...

As Scott walked down the empty streets of downtown Metropolis he listened to his favorite podcast on his phone, his head held down to avoid any eye contact with strangers. One would think that a city with such a colorful cast of supervillains would be completely unsafe to traverse at night, but the opposite tended to true. With Bird Boy and Cat Girl running around, common everyday criminals were hesitant to cause trouble for other citizens. The presence of supervillains also acted as a deterrent, as they didn't very much care for lesser evildoers taking up space.

Not that any of that was a concern to Scott. He wasn't the type to immerse himself in the current events, preferring immerse himself in his comics and video games. He ignored his mother's many warnings to come home early and to beware of any strange smells in the area, mostly in part to his inherent optimism bias. Up till then, his life had been completely unremarkable and devoid of any real hardships or conflict. All that was about to change, as he happened to catch the eye of one of the city's most prominent figures...

15111.content:
Trouble was just around the corner for Scott, as a stretch limousine sped down the street in complete disregard for the safety of any pedestrians nearby. Sitting in the back was Brooke Armstrong, the spoiled aristocrat with a propensity for tormenting others for her own sick amusement. Her disposition was far from positive, as she had once again failed to get Jake's attention while out on at a social gathering for the city's most wealthy. Many times she attempted to pressure him into dancing with her, often while in the company of roving photographers, but he would expertly weave a narrative that excused him from her presence.

The sting of rejection still lingered in her mind as she sat in the limo with her arms folded and her face in a permanent scowl. Her driver did his best not to make eye contact with her, as he knew of her propensity for abusing the staff whenever she was in a bad mood. Or a good mood. He could practically feel the anger radiating off of her as she looked around for something, anything to take her frustration out on. Then, without warning, her face suddenly became calm and a bright smile spread along her face.

"Jeeves, I want a pet" she said suddenly.

"I beg your pardon, madam?"

"I said I want a pet. You know, a nice cuddly little creature that will always love me" she said with childlike optimism.

"Ah. Excellent idea, madam. You would make an excellent pet owner" Jeeves said with a half smile. In truth, he shuddered at the thought of someone so cruel and selfish as her taking care of an animal of any kind. Even the most fearsome of predators would crumble and cower after spending five minutes within her presence. Still, he was willing to humor her if it meant that he wouldn't suffer the brunt of her unbridled aggression.

"Drive to the nearest pet store then. I think I'll get me a giraffe... or maybe a lion cub" she giggled.

"Um... I don't think there are any pet stores open this time of night, madam. You needn't worry though. I will inform the staff to acquire the animal you seek first thing in the morning"

In a matter of seconds, the atmosphere in the car grew darker as Brooke's face soured. Jeeves sighed and mentally kicked himself for forgetting the golden rule of dealing with his employer: never tell her something that she doesn't want to hear.

"I don't want to wait until tomorrow. I want a pet now"

"Miss Armstrong, you will get your pet. All that's required is a bit of patience" he said calmly.

"I want it now!" she cried as her face reddened and her fists clenched.

"Miss Armstrong, behavior such as this is unbecoming of one as lovely and intelligent as yourself. The nearest pet store opens at seven in the morning, which is only nine hours away. There are plenty of things you can do in the meantime that will make those hours fly by. Now, how about we get home and I prepare you a nice hot bath?" he asked with a polite smile.

Brooke continued to glare at him, though her expression quickly faltered. At first Jeeves thought he had gotten through to her, but that thought was undercut by the immediate tantrum that soon followed. She spoiled billionaire bawled her eyes out, kicking and stomping her feet much like she would do as a child.

"I WANT A PET! I WANT A PET! IWANTONEIWANTONEIWANTONE!!" she screeched.

'This is why we soundproof all the vehicles' Jeeves thought to himself as he continued to drive down the empty streets. For the time being, he decided to start driving around the block in a continuous loop, waiting for Brooke to tire herself out before they arrived home. Had she returned in such a state, the other staff would surely suffer because of it. Jeeves had been with her since she was but a wee girl and as such, knew how to best placate her and curb her foul temper. That said, it was still taxing on his mind to constantly deal with it. For almost an hour he drove around in circles, patiently waiting for Brooke to calm down. Eventually his plan worked and Brooke back in her seat sobbing quietly, muttering about how the world hated her and how unfair life was. He was about to head back home when she suddenly let out a gasp and jolted from her seat.

"Stop the car!" She ordered sternly as she stared out the window.

Jeeves screeched to a halt and followed her gaze over to the unremarkable sight of a scrawny young man walking down the street with his head hung low.

"There! I want that!" she cried excitedly as she pointed at the young man.

"What do you mean, madam?"

"That's the pet I want!" She explained in an annoyed tone.

Jeeves stared blankly at her, unsure of what to make of the bizarre request. It wasn't uncalled for to see her single out a complete stranger to use as her plaything, but generally speaking she would always regard them as people. By the tone of her voice, it was clear that she didn't regard the young man as a person, further driven by her referring to him as "that". After a minute he simply shrugged and brought the limousine over to the poor boy.

"Better him than me..." he thought to himself.
______________

The sound of a car horn jolted Scott from his thoughts, bringing him back to reality. Somehow had been completely oblivious to the large limousine driving along beside him from the last five minutes. He wasn't given much time to thinking about it before the door swung open, revealing a full figured blonde haired girl looking at him with hungry eyes. Something about her expression made him feel uneasy, though her physical attractiveness proved to be disarming.

"You are SO CUTE! You wanna come home with me, little fella? Huh? I can give you a nice warm bed to sleep in and all the food you can eat~" she cooed in an oddly affectionate manner.

Scott glanced around expecting to find a stray animal nearby, but saw nothing. Looking back up at the strange woman he pointed a finger at himself to make sure he was certain that he was the one being address.

"Yes you, silly! Come on out of the cold and sit with me!" she giggled patting the seat beside her.

His instincts told him to simply walk away and hope that the strange woman wouldn't follow, they conflicted with his raging hormones. He had spent most of his teenage years being laughed and and rejected by girls and suddenly a pretty and presumably wealthy girl pulls up in a limousine, calls him cute and invites him inside. It was a lot for him to take in at once. Eventually, the temptation became to much and he hesitantly walked up to the limo. He was barely a foot inside before the girl yanked him inside with surprising strength.

"Aren't you the cutest widdle thing~" she cooed as she embraced him in a vice-like grip, his face being mashed against her plump breasts. After a minute of suffocating him, she pulled back and looked at him with a wide smile.

"I'll name you... Jake! And you'll be my best friend forever and ever and ever!" she chimed before kissing him on his forehead.

Scott was somewhat taken aback by her odd behavior, though he didn't think to voice his confusion as he found a small bit of perverse enjoyment from it. He had no idea that he had signed away his humanity the moment he decided to enter the car. In his naive mind, he thought that she was nothing more than a weird eccentric with some odd kinks. He could only imagine the looks of jealousy he would receive from his peers when she dropped him off at his school.

He could see it now: strutting down the halls confidently with his buxom girlfriend's arm hooked around his, dressed in the most expensive clothing line that money could afford. His fellow nerds congradulating him for his success while the jocks and bullies fell to their knees in awe of his evident superiority. In fact, he wouldn't even need to go to school. With his girlfriend's money, he wouldn't have to go to school ever again. The rest of his days would be spent in the lap of luxury, playing video games and enjoying her company. The thought of it brought a smile to his face.

His fantasy was interrupted as his new "girlfriend" said...
15111.title: Brooke Armstrong (Aka Queen Bee)
