152.content:
When citizens of Metropolis speak of the city's villains, the most common reaction is fear, hatred, or disgust. For a few individuals, the mention of the villains evokes a more positive, even lustful reaction. For even fewer, the villains are regarded with scientific curiosity. Connor Slate is a member of the last group, and is a researcher at Metropolis's first public, ethical research lab. In this place, researchers work hard to study what makes villains tick, and how to either neutralize, replicate, or weaponize their various powers. Of course, given the guidelines the researchers have to follow, gathering data can be...difficult. Informed consent is a must, even though the test subjects are all villains who have already been convicted and jailed. As such, finding willing participants can be difficult. Additionally, researchers have to ensure that their subjects are comfortable and treated humanely. That wouldn't be a problem if subjects didn't demand that researchers smell, worship, or have sex with them in order to ensure said comfort. Among the researchers in the facility, Connor's good looks, sexual openness, sensitive genitals, and even more sensitive nose make him the favorite toy of many of the subjects held within. Life can be pretty rough, and most of the time, researchers are tricked into doing things without getting what they need from their subjects. But the few bits of data they have gained have been invaluable. Especially in upgrading the police department with nonlethal Lust Bombs synthesized from Nasty Neko's pheromones!

Connor groaned as he sat up in his bed. From the looks of things, he'd been brought home after he'd foolishly agreed to smell Neko's socks in order to get a blood sample. Connor wasn't sure if Neko had honored the deal, as he had fainted after only a handfull of sniffs, but he was sure he'd find out. After a quick bowl of cereal and a shower, Connor donned his lab coat and headed down to the lab. The huge complex looked more like a fortress than a research lab, but how else would you build a place made to study the most dangerous individuals in the world? Especially when funded by Blackridge Inc.! Connor parked in his designated spot and hurried inside the building. Late workers were often punished by having to work in the Ancient wing.

As he stepped inside the building, he saw the big sign that everyone saw when they entered the complex. Said sign detailed the various categories by which villains, and the various wings where they were held, were sorted into. Researchers were routinely switched between research wings, which, while it slowed the process down significantly, was a necessity to prevent any one villain from gaining too much of a hold over a person. The test subjects in the facility were separated into the categories of Mind, Body, Nonhuman, and Ancient. Subjects in the Mind wing were the sort that used their powers to play mindgames or avoid physical contact like Goth Goddess or Waft. Body subjects were all physical combatants, those who used sheer strength, skill, or stench to overwhelm like Havoc. Nonhuman subjects were subdivided according to power as well, but this is where robots such as Skunkinator, and anthros like Skunkette were held. Finally, the Ancient wing was where the villains who'd been alive for at least two centuries were held, their immense power meant that they had to have more space and distance from other subjects.

Connor ran through the facility, tripping several times as he tried to clock in before 8:00. After he reached the device and entered his employee number...
152.title: Connor Slate: Secret Researcher

He only had one assignment today- that was either because the facility would be taking it easy on him after yesterday's incident, or because his assignment today was potentially more dangerous than usual. His assignment was in the body wing, room 122. Conor quickly gathered his bag and moved to the room.


Once inside, he found his subject sitting on the provided cot, facing the wall. A large, stocky woman, clad completely in a black robe, with fiery red hair flowing down to her mid-back. The woman turned her head to look over her shoulder, revealing a beautiful, young face. The woman giggled as she turned around. "You must be my slut for the day..." Rebecca awoke at the crack of dawn, as she always did, to the sound of the roosters making their early morning cries. She slid out from her bunk, and shook some of her other "sisters" awake. Rebecca's sleeping cabin was shared by ten girls, ranging from ages 15 to 38. Rebecca herself was 23 years old, and had been a member of Abigail's family for the last four years. She didn't remember much of her life beforehand- Abigail's toejam conditioning made sure of that. No, the only parts of her life she could remember were the ones she spent serving Abigail.

The majority of followers either spent the days working the fields, or cleaning the main house of Raven Falls. Rebecca, however, was one of Abigail's personal servants, and spent most of her day directly servicing her mistress. Today, her instructions told her to report to the cellar of the main house. The cellar was where Abigail housed all of her "new recruits" (I.e. Prisoners who had yet to be converted), and they also were home to Abigail's Punishment Rooms, filled with various torturous mechanisms and nightmarish contraptions, that she used on misbehaving Whipping Girls.


Today, when Rebecca went down to the cellar with Mika and Georgia, two more of Abigail's personal servants, they were surprised to see Abigail already awake, and coming out of one of the rooms. Abigail had a wide, sinister grin on her face as she beckoned the girls closer. "I have wonderful news, ladies..." Abigail said, giggling. info.brief_description: Have you ever wanted to explore the world of Smelly Super Villains? Now's your chance!
info.description:
Smelly Super Villains is a story that focuses mainly on the lives of Birdboy and Catgirl, as they attempt to keep the city safe from the villainous horde that constantly bombards the city of Metropolis. While this is fun and all, it doesn't leave a lot of room for exploration, or self-insertion. Well, you all wanted it, so you're all getting it.

Citizens of Metropolis is an interactive story based in the SSV universe, but instead of focusing on Birdboy and Catgirl, the focus is more on the civilians, as they go about their everyday lives, and truly their best to live in a city populated by some of the most depraved, disgusting, and evil beings that have ever been dreamed up. As one could imagine, it could be rather hard to go a single day without bumping into one of the villains, and for some, the results of that meeting could be life-changing.

Citizens is an alternative choice to the very storyline driven Smelly Super Villains. You wanna insert? You wanna skip the chapters upon chapters of story and cut right to the smut? Go for it. That's what this is here for.


A few rules here:
1. This story is meant to focus more on the citizens of Metropolis, rather than Birdboy and Catgirl. Please leave them out of this story, besides maybe some occasional cameos. If you want a storyline about Birdboy and Catgirl, go read/add to Smelly Super Villains
2. Please, and I can not stress this enough, proper spelling and grammar are important. I will delete poor entries.
3. The deletion warning also goes for additions that are a mere few sentences in length. Please. At the very least, your entry should be 1000 characters.
4. Please only feature Villains who are already established in the canon of Smelly Super Villains. Want to add your own, brand new villain? Go add it to Smelly Super Villains and come back. Otherwise, use those already established.
5. You should probably have a good sense for Smelly Super Villains before you come here anyways. I mean, that's why you wanna be tortured by said Villains, right? Because you read about them, and liked them?

Nothing is really off limits here. You wanna fuck one of the Villains? Go for it.


Get in there and smut, y'all. Have fun. Be nice.


And stay safe! Some of those Villains don't play fair. Especially with the civilians...


Smelly Super Villains link, if you need it: https://www.writing.com/main/interact/item_id/1934117-Smelly-super-villains
info.pretty_title: Citizens of Metropolis: An SSV Spinoff
